messages.message: :wave: hiyo! Not sure where to put this — we have a solutions architect candidate who wanted to demo Instabase to us as part of his interview. He’s got a UDF he’s working on but is getting an error saying he doesn’t have rights to execute custom scripts. Is that something we need to turn on for new accounts? Or is there a broader permissions concern there? His username is *jackingoldsby* if it’s simple to give him the right permissions. If it’s not simple, that’s fine too; he says he’s fine to explain what ought to happen during the demo, but figured I’d check and see if there was a simple fix first.
Unless he’s working inside an org owned repo where we can give him localized permissions, he’d need to be a site wide admin to run scripts
The reason is that UDFs are so inherently dangerous (since we don’t know what’s in them), our security permissions around those are tight
For now I’ll just ask him to explain his intent
(i.e. we won’t grant the permissions, but he can tell us what he’d hoped his script would do)
Right, and I’m also super happy to look over the script (he’s free to debug it on his own machine if he wants), and run etc and give you my technical impressions, if that’d be useful
He says he can just show it in a notebook to illustrate what he wanted to show. Thanks for the offer though! (Also, v curious to see what it is he's built haha)
Ok, if he doesn’t need it to be in the flow, yea that’s perfect too! Yup!
